doc:
May Hallatt https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/May_Hallatt 0 May Hallatt (born Marie Effie Hullatt; 1 May 1876 – 20 May 1969) was a British actress, born in Scarborough. Baptised at St Michael on the Mount, Lincoln, on 13 Jan 1884 she was the daughter of William Henry Hallatt, actor, and Carrie Sydney. A number of published sources incorrectly name her as mother of the actor Neil Hallett Often cast in eccentric roles, within her 30-year career, she was known for Black Narcissus (1947), Painted Boats (1945) and Separate Tables (1958).In Terence Rattigan's Separate Tables, she played Miss Meacham in the original West End, Broadway and film versions. May_Hallatt ( born Marie_Effie_Hullatt ; 1_May_1876 – 20_May_1969 ) was a_British_actress , born in Scarborough . Baptised at St_Michael on the_Mount_,_Lincoln , on 13_Jan_1884 she was the_daughter of William_Henry_Hallatt , actor , and Carrie_Sydney . A_number of published_sources incorrectly name her as mother of the_actor_Neil_Hallett Often cast in eccentric_roles , within her_30-year_career , she was_known for Black_Narcissus_(_1947_) , Painted_Boats_(_1945_)_and_Separate_Tables ( 1958_) . In Terence_Rattigan 's_Separate_Tables , she played Miss_Meacham in the_original_West_End , Broadway and film_versions .
